class.name: Rope
class.description: The class renders "rope" using verlet integration. It supports using nodes as rope ends, as well as attaching the rope to other objects in a scene.

method.name: get_baked_mesh
method.description: Returns the current mesh of the rope. Changes every physics frame.

members.member: Length of the rope. Segments will be `rope_length / rope_particles` long.
NodePath to a node to anchor the start of the rope to. The origin of the rope will follow this node. Can point to self.
NodePath to a node to anchor the end of the rope to. The end of the rope will follow this node.

A RopePositions resource containing additional anchors to attach the rope to. All anchors will be aligned to the nearest frame, and so the positions are dependent on the number of particles in the rope and the LOD.
A RopeAppearance resource containing properties that control how the rope is rendered.
Framerate to run the simulation at in FPS.
When performing stiffness calculations, the number of passes through the rope to run per frame. Higher values will improve stiffness stability.
Stiffness factor. Controls stretchyness of rope. Should be around [0.8 - 1.2] for a realistic rope. Higher values may lead to instability in the simulation.
Scale factor to apply to the wind vector when applying it to the rope simulation.

member.name: wind_noise
member.member: Gravity vector to apply to the rope simulation. Default is (0, -9.8, 0).
Velocity damping factor to apply to the rope simulation. 0 is undamped, 100 is heavily damped.

members.member: When the rope is first created, the number of simulations steps to run before rendering for the first time. Simulation will be run at `preprocess_delta` time steps.
Time step to run the pre-process simulation at when the rope is rebuilt. In seconds.
